cloudshell.helpers.scripts package¶

Submodules¶

cloudshell.helpers.scripts.cloudshell_dev_helpers module¶

cloudshell.helpers.scripts.cloudshell_dev_helpers.attach_to_cloudshell(filename='quali_config.json')[source]¶

This helper is intended to make it easier to test scripts. When a script gets executed by CloudShell, the Execution Server sets up several variables as a context for the execution. This function simulates the same conditions so the script can be tested offline. Using this overload, all information is retrieved from a JSON config file which should be of the following format: {

“user” : “admin”, “password” : “admin”, “domain” : “Global”, “server_address” : “localhost”, “cloudshell_api_port” : “8028”

} :param str filename: The configuration filename path

cloudshell.helpers.scripts.cloudshell_dev_helpers.attach_to_cloudshell_as(user, password, domain, reservation_id, server_address='localhost', cloudshell_api_port='8028', command_parameters={}, resource_name=None, service_name=None)[source]¶

This helper is intended to make it easier to test scripts. When a script gets executed by CloudShell, the Execution Server sets up several variables as a context for the execution. This function simulates the same conditions so the script can be tested offline. :param str user: The user the driver should authenticate as :param str passwrd: Password for the specified user :param str reservation_id: The reservation the driver should attach to :param str server_address: The address of the CloudShell server (default to localhost) :param str cloudshell_api_port: The API port to use (default 8028) :param dict[str,str] command_parameters: user parameters passed to this command :param str resource_name: For resource commands only specify the name of the resource
